intro: Hibbertia leptopus, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, elongated leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, which are typically borne in clusters. Hibbertia leptopus is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal regions. It is a low-growing shrub that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid environments.
